Dos: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth or bandage.
Elevate the injured area if possible, unless it's a bone injury.
Use a tourniquet only as a last resort if bleeding cannot be controlled by other means.
Keep the person lying down to prevent shock.
Donts: Do not remove a lodged object if it caused the bleeding; stabilize the object and seek medical help.
Avoid using a tourniquet unless absolutely necessary, as it can cause complications.

Dos: Call 911 (or the emergency number in your region) immediately.
Initiate CPR with chest compressions and rescue breaths.
Donts: Do not delay calling for professional medical assistance.

Dos: Perform the Heimlich maneuver or back blows to dislodge the obstructing object.
Encourage the victim to cough forcefully if they can.
Donts: Avoid using excessive force during the Heimlich maneuver, which may cause injury.

Dos: Administer epinephrine (if available) as prescribed.
Call 911 immediately.
Help the person to lie down and elevate their legs to improve blood flow.
Donts: Do not wait to see if symptoms improve on their own.

Dos: Keep the person still and support their head and neck to prevent movement.
Apply a clean cloth or bandage to any bleeding head wounds.
Donts: Avoid moving the person unnecessarily, especially if there is a suspicion of spinal injury.

Dos: Immobilize the spine by keeping the person still and supporting the head and neck.
Call 911 and wait for professional medical assistance.
Donts: Avoid attempting to realign the spine or move the person without proper training.

Dos: Turn off the power source or disconnect the victim from the electrical source if safe to do so.
Call 911 immediately.
Administer CPR if the person is unresponsive.
Donts: Do not touch the person if they are still in contact with the electrical source.

Dos: Cool the burn with running cold water for at least 10 minutes.
Cover the burn with a clean, non-stick bandage or cloth.
Seek medical attention for deep burns or burns affecting the airway.
Donts: Avoid using ice or very cold water, as it may further damage the tissue.

Dos: Perform rescue and remove the person from the water if safe to do so.
Initiate CPR if the person is unresponsive and not breathing.
Donts: Do not delay rescue efforts or CPR if needed.

Dos: Immobilize the injured area to prevent further movement.
Apply a splint or padding to stabilize the broken bone.
Seek professional medical attention.
Donts: Avoid attempting to realign the bone unless you are trained to do so.
